comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Nice to see another raffle for a quality HW wallet.c - KryptowerkThere are a few important qualities to a good mixer. The obvious ones include anonymity of user-data.However I'd say one of the maybe overlooked ones is ease-of-use and adoption.Ideally you can easily access the mixer within a wallet with just a few clicks. This increases the number of mixed BTC - if everyone would use a mixer, all coins would be equal again. Ofc this would also need low fees - which would be possible of volume is high enough.Just my 2 sats. Thanks.

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Quote from: BTCOVERFIATS on August 17, 2023, 04:10:07 PM6 pleaseFor a good mixer you need one quality. Anonymity of user-data and that's it. As long as you have that you're good to goTo build off this a good mixer also needs to have a high amount of users using the mixing service to allow for a solid coinjoin. Having a threshold for a minimum amount of users, let's say 50 per conjoin helps with anonymity.Also it must have TOR capabilities as well as the option to mix multiple values of BTC at a time. For example mixing 1 BTC, 0.5 BTC, or 0.1 BTC at a time is a must.

comments.author: av8rjeff
comments.body: 5 - av8rjeffI don't have much to add that other's haven't already mentions (anonymity, tor, focus on high volume coupled with low fees, etc), so I'm going to approach this in a different way.  If I was developing a new product (in this case a mixing service), I would study the competition and list their strengths and weaknesses as posted or commented on by their users in reviews or reddit or where ever.  Easy enough to keep or mimic the pros but addressing and correcting the weaknesses would be my focus.  It's easy to say "low fees" but creating enough volume to make a viable business model...that might be tough.  IDK.  Do any mixing services use a Liquidity Provider (LP) model, where users can stake bitcoin to help increase liquidity in return for a share of the revenue?  Problem there of course is trust, ala Celsius and others.  If you could build a mixing service where we could provide liquidity and earn yield, while retaining control of our coins/keys (so non-custodial), that would truly be something.  Actually...DASH already did that years ago with their Masternodes, which allowed for PrivateSend (mixing service) and InstantSend (instant transactions).  Man...I loved DASH.  I hope it can rise from the ashes some day.

And this also helps in earning credibility.Note: I chose "d" since the earlier user which chose "d" had the post rejected.
